Members of the Special Task Force attack Foron village, destroying houses and ransacking property. It is believed the soldiers were acting on behalf of a group of Fulanis who had declared property stolen by the villagers. Berom youth allegedly respond and shoot at STF soldiers.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Malari and Alaw villages in Konduga Local Government Area on 02/07. At least 13 dead and 21 injured.
Unidentified gunmen attack Kokiya village, six dead.
Boko Haram attacks Bama on 03/07. Causalities not known.
Boko Haram attacks Koshebe village in Mafa LGA on 03/07. Causalities not known. "Scores killed" in the attack.

In the early hours of 03/07 Boko Haram insurgents reportedly trailed about 13 of their defecting members and killed 11 of them in Miringa village in Biu Local Government Area of Borno State. Sources said the defecting members were forcefully conscripted by Boko Haram several months ago.
Boko Haram invades Mussa "B" village on 03/07 killing 29 residents, plus injuries. The attack occurred midday.
Boko Haram forces attack Maiduguri on 03/07, but are repelled by military forces and the "Civilian JTF." Causalities not known.
Children protest in Yakurr against child marriage.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
NOTES: Members of the ASUU, Ambrose Alli University (AAU), Ekpoma Chapter took to the streets of the university town to protest the recent kidnap of their colleague.
Construction workers protest non-payment of seven months salaries in Abaji.
A prominent politician and businessman is shot and killed by unknown assailants.
At least 55 people have been killed in a 04/07 attack by Boko Haram suicide bombers in Zabamari, Jere LGA, 6 miles from Maiduguri.
Members of the NYSC protest unpaid allowances "at the weekend" in Minna.
Unidentified gunmen attack Cigama village of Birnin Magaji on 03/07, killing 70 and injuring others. It is believed the same group attack Kokiya village two days prior.

No fewer than three people were reportedly killed and property running into millions of naira destroyed when rampaging youths from Bakume and Abejukolo descended on Ogba village in Omala Local Government Area of Kogi State. It is believed the youths launched the raid over the town's support for Fulanis.

A pair of explosions during the night  at a Jos mosque and restaurant cause at least 44 deaths. The cause of the explosions not known. Boko Haram are suspected, but no group has claimed responsibility.
A suicide bomber killed himself, a pastor and four worshipers at a Potiskum church. No report of the bomber's association.
Members of CAN protest the Boko Haram prisoner relocation to a nearby location.

Five people were injured when Gbagyi youths from Chikun Local Government Area of Kaduna state blocked major roads leading to the secretariat of the local government to protest the appointment of the interim chairman of the area. Police and military personnel from Operation Yaki are called in to disperse the rioters. Gbagyi demonstrators accuse the Operation Yaki personnel of firing live ammo leading to injuries, while the authorities deny this accusation.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: A female suicide bomber attacks Dange roundabout in Kano killing herself only. The affiliation of the attacker is not known. The target of the attack was believed to be a mosque.
Non-academic staff of Obafemi Awolowo University protest over non-payment of salaries in Ile-Ife.
Following an attack on a mosque on 05/07 a protesting group burns two churches.
Unidentified persons attacked and killed an Agip Oil manager. The reason for the attack is not known - the perpetrators took nothing off the victims' person.
A unidentified suicide bomber attacks a military checkpoint at Sabon Gari location in Damboa LGA. Four reported deaths.
Residents of Iwogban community protest at Head office of Benin Electricity Distribution Company (Benin City) over a persistent blackout in their village.
Hundreds protest power outages in Igarra.
Employees of a hospital in Owerri protest for the removal of its chief medical officer over "highhandedness" and "inhuman policies." Police forces were present at the protest.
A female Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a school in Zaria, killing 25 (later raised to 37) and injuring 32.
The Nigeria Union of Journalists picketed the premises of ThisDay newspapers in Apapa, Lagos to protest the non-payment of nine months arrears of salaries.
Students protest at Illorin government house over the non-payment of bursary allowance.
Scores of protesters sustained various degree of injuries as pro and anti-Aregbesola (the governor) protests turned violent in Osogbo. Date of the protests not known - source dated 08/07.

A suicide bomber strikes in the Kofare area. The bomb explosion occurred near a mechanic workshop opposite the State Headquarters of the Federal Road Safety Commission resulting in two civilians sustaining injuries. Identity of perpetrators not reported.
Recently terminated staff of the Kaduna State Traffic and Environmental Law Enforcement Agency protest the loss of their appointments.
LSU students block the Badagry and Iba expressways of Lagos in protest of an impasse of the staff union and the state government.
Residents of Mushin protest a series of police raids they believe unjust. The protest took place at Olosan Police Station, in Lagos.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Conflicting reports of an explosion or attempt to burn down the federal high court building in Port Harcourt. The governor reported explosions, although police report no such attack occurred and instead an attempt to burn down the court was foiled.
Boko Haram attacks Ngamdu on the night of 10/07, some 100 kilometres (60 miles) from Maiduguri, killing 11.
Boko Haram attacks and kills 43 in the villages of Kalwa, Misala and Gwollam of Monguno LGA on 10/07.
An unidentified armed group attacks and kills a monarch and three others at Nkerefi in Nkanu East Local Government Area on 10/07.
Boko Haram attack and kill a monarch and three others at Nkerefi in Nkanu East Local Government Area on 10/07.
Boko Haram attacks Buni Yadi on 10/07, kills nine.
Boko Haram attacks and battles military forces at Ngamdu, Mainok and Jakana locations in Borno State on 11/07. "Scores" dead.
Boko Haram attacks and battles military forces at Ngamdu, Mainok and Jakana locations in Borno State on 11/07. "Scores" dead.
Boko Haram attacks and battles military forces at Ngamdu, Mainok and Jakana locations in Borno State on 11/07. "Scores" dead.
An unidentified suicide bomber kills four, plus himself, and injures three others along a highway in Maiduguri during the early morning hours.

Boko Haram suicide bombers target the Borno Express Terminus Motor Park, location not known,  killing two passerby and injuring three others. The number of bombers killed in the explosion are not known.
Students of the Federal Polytechnic Ede, Osun State and people of the Ede Community, "weekend" staged a protest to Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company over frequent power outages.

Many worshippers are currently feared dead and several others injured in Sunday [12 July] morning twin bomb explosions at ECWA Church in Tudun Wada, near the Federal Secretariat in Jos, Jos North. Perpetrators not known.
A ethnically motivated beheading causes a clash between Igedes and Ado groups. The initial perpetrator is not known. The clash caused a protest in the area.

Youths from Obi Local Government Area of Benue State, in Igedeland, stormed a village in Ojenyo ward of Ado Local Government Area following a beheading of their kinsman (either Ado or Igedes, group unknown). The protesters caused "mayhem."
Four people killed were killed on 13/07 when a suicide bomber hit a military checkpoint on the outskirts of the north-eastern Nigerian city of Maiduguri.
Boko Haram attacks Mainuk on 13/07, thirty causalities.
Okada commercial motorcyclists "recently" protest against alleged extortion by officers of Kwara State Road Transport Management Agency. Source dated 13/07.
Unidentified gunmen kill three members of an unnamed militia group in Kofar Gwari ward of Kokona Local Government Area of Nasarawa on 13/07.
Eleven (some sources claim 20) are dead following a clash between Boko Haram and military forces in Warsala, Ngamdu on 14/07.
Workers of Adavi Local Government Area of Kogi State protested for the payment of their salaries.
A unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle attacked and killed three people in Gbengen village in Katsina Ala Local Government for unknown reason.
Boko Haram attacks Damasak on 15/07, twelve causalities.

48 hours after Boko Haram attacked Mainok, which left 30 persons dead and most part of the village burnt, Boko Haram on 15/07 returned to attack village for a second time in a week, killing an additional 15.
A Tiv group of 5,000+ protests a spate of killings by Fulanis at the Jalingo government house.
Boko Haram attacked Hambagtha and Limankara in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno State on 16/07 killing "scores" of people and destroying houses.
Boko Haram attacked Hambagtha and Limankara in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno State on 16/07 killing "scores" of people and destroying houses.
400 from Ijaw communities protest at the Delta State House assembly over a proposed bill that would jeopardise their oil producing future.
Delta State University, Oleh Campus is closed when students protest the death of three of their colleagues at the hands of a thief.
Youths protest persistent power outages in Ikere on 16/07.
Twin suspected Boko Haram suicide blasts strike a Gombe bus station, 49 dead, 71 injured. Boko Haram suspected.
Hospital workers protest non-payment of entitlements in suburban Lagos.
Gunmen suspected to be assassins shot dead a chieftain of the APC, at Festac Town, in Amuwo Odofin Local Government Area on 16/07.

Fifty are confirmed dead following three coordinated suicide explosions (of which included a 10-year-old girl) in Damaturu on the morning of 17/06. The attacks occurred at screening areas for intending Muslim worshippers at Laying Grange, Damaturu and at Phase1, in front of former state secretariat, Damaturu. Identities of the perpetrators not speculated in the source. At the initial time of the attack 9-13 were believed dead.
Awardees of the Youwin Three Programme protest over non-payment in Jalingo.
Unknown gunmen killed 24, including a prominent PDP politician believed to be the "godfather" of former governor Gabriel Suswam in Kastina-Ala town of Benue State.
Boko Haram attacks Sabon Gari on 17/07, killing 10.
A couple is shot and killed by unidentified gunmen in Katsina-Ala LGA. The attack was described as an "assassination." A politician was killed in the area the previous day.
A church is forced to close after two pastors and their loyalists engaged fierce battle over who controls the parish.
Residents blockade a oil refinery in Korama, demanding electricity from the facility.
Three police and five members of Boko Haram are dead after the latter carried out a bomb attack on a police outpost in Damaturu.
Residents of Olomoro block roads in protest of the movement of a community centre.
Hausa and Berom militias clash in Barikin Ladi LGA on 21/07. Four believed dead. In a separate incident in the area unidentified gunmen kill four in a bar.
University of Benin students protest the alleged killing of a fellow student by police.
A unidentified group protests PDP meetings in Umuokpu, Otolo and Ukpo, Anambra.
Construction workers protest poor welfare in Lagos on 21/07.
A unidentified group protests PDP meetings in Umuokpu, Otolo and Ukpo, Anambra.
A unidentified group protests PDP meetings in Umuokpu, Otolo and Ukpo, Anambra.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on a drinking establishment in Barikin Ladi LGA, four dead. The motive for the attack is not known.
Members of an Enugu State community protest the imposition of a monarch in Enugu City.
Nigerians working for a Chinese company protested their employment termination.
Parents of perspective University of Lagos students protest a change of examination policy.
Twin bomb blasts at bus stations in Gombe kill 29, plus many injuries. Boko Haram suspected.
Suspected Boko Haram attack Pompommari, kill eight. Date disputed, either 22/07 or 23/07.
A PDP senior official of Ahoada West LGA is assassinated at his home in Port Harcourt.
Medicine dealers protest forced closure of their shops by a pharmaceutical lobby.
Members of a motorcycle club protest government policies that hinder their transport activities.
Youths of the APC and PDP clash at a protest/counter protest against the actions by the governor in Jos. Injuries not known.
Scores of Bayelsa youths on 23/07 staged a protest to demand for the appointment of indigenes into management positions in the Federal University, Otuoke (FUO).
Residents protest the abduction of a traditional ruler of Tombia community.
A traditional ruler is abducted in Tombia. The abduction sparked a protest in Yenagoa.
Military forces retake Dikwa following a heavy bombardment. Causalities not known. It was later revealed military forces were able to release 30 Boko Haram hostages.
Traders protest forced eviction from their stalls.
Boko Haram attacks a village in Madagali LGA killing 25
Boko Haram attacks Maikadiri, Askira/Uba LGA during the morning hours 15 dead
Benue State University students protest the death of their colleague at the gate of the university. The protesters believe the student's expulsion from the institution drove him to his death.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber targets a Damaturu market, 15 reported dead, 50 injured. It is believed the bomber was a "mentally handicapped female."
A government operative is attacked by a group of commercial motorcyclists after it is believed he shot a police officer in a dispute.

Boko Haram attacks Buratai during the evening hours but are repelled by military forces. Causalities not known. Boko Haram regrouped and made a second pass at the town the following morning, but are equally repelled by military forces. Causalities unknown from the second attack.
Boko Haram attacks Dille, military forces retaliate, killing 11 of the attackers. Civilian casualties reported, though exact numbers are not known.
A workers union strikes, protests for better wages outside the state secretariat. The strike reportedly affected activity throughout the state.
Boko Haram attacks of Mwuthamam (near Dille) on 27/07, casualties reported, tough numbers are not known.

Boko Haram slit the throats of 10 fishermen in villages (Bundaram, where they killed four people, Fishdam, where they killed two people, and Kwatar Mali, remainder)  near Baga on the shores of the Lake Chad.
A teacher is shot and killed by unidentified gunmen on 27/07.

Boko Haram attacks Buratai during the evening hours but are repelled by military forces. Causalities not known. Boko Haram regrouped and made a second pass at the town the following morning, but are equally repelled by military forces. Causalities unknown from the second attack.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as 'government's insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary." Protest were believed to be held in all areas.
NUP protests in Akure over the non-payment of their gratuities, allowances and harmonisation arrears.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as 'government's insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary." Protest were believed to be held in all areas.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
NOTES: Military forces free 59 Boko Haram hostages in Konduga LGA, no reported violence.
Protesters went to the National Assembly complex in Abuja to register their displeasure over Amnesty International report on rights abuses by the Nigerian military.
People affected with leprosy protest government neglect in Agbor.
Mobs kill two suspected motorcycle thieves in Akwanga.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: KAROTA: Kano Road and Traffic Agency
NOTES: Commercial drivers and members of KAROTA clash over an illegal motor park. Injuries reported.
Unidentified gunmen attack Zaki Biam yam market, kill 10 and injure others.
Two factions of the Ekiti State PDP fired shots at each other at the state's party secretariat. A leader of one of the factions was injured in the shootout.

Students blocked the Akure/Owo Expressway over a spate of accidents along the road. The students called on the Federal Government to create an alternative routes for trucks and trailers on the road or ban them from moving during the day time.

Elderly women and youths marched through major streets of Obubra Local Government Area of Cross River State to caution the incumbent chairman of the council not to attempt making a come back with a second term.
Ten are dead after Boko Haram attacks Kukuwa-Gari village of Gujba on 31/07.
A Boko Haram suicide attack kills eight in Maiduguri's Gamboru market.
Unidentified gunmen riding motorcycles storm Zaki-Biam, Ukum local government area of Benue State, killing eight.

EVENT_TYPE: Non-violent activity by a conflict actor
ACTOR1: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
NOTES: 140 members of the "Formed Police Unit (UPC)" left Brazzaville to join MINUSCA for deployment around Bangui and its surroundings.
Over 30 workers of the newly-constructed Mt. Kenya University in Kicukiro district of Kigali engaged in a sit-in protest to demand payment of their wages.

ACTOR1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
NOTES: Burundi has claimed that rebels have set up military training camps in Rwanda and that the generals who attempted to stage a coup on May 13 are being harboured in that country.
Protesters were prevented from marching but still grouped publicly to express their outrage over the recent kidnapping of a 4 year old girl in Rufisque.
Protesters from Bamacounda, Malifara and Kountoubou marched to demand electrification of their villages by SENELEC.

12 loggers were abducted by an armed gang near Kolling (lat/longs not available) in the Casamance region. The kidnappers demanded a ransom and they were later released on Jul.12. Local media believed that the kidnappers may have been a splinter of the MFDC.
Independent Union of Physicians Senegal went on a 48-hour strike, demanding the restoration of rights of two colleagues that were fired.

An IED detonated at SNG forces vehicle in Heliwa's livestock market in the afternoon of 01/07. It is not known if the device was a RCIED or land mine planted along the road. Unknown numbers of SNG soldiers were affected in the explosion.

Unidentified three gunmen attacked a mosque in which worshippers were performing ISHA prayers in the vicinity of Gubta (Dayniile District) in the night of 01/07. According to the reports received from where the incident happened, the target of the attackers was two elders who were praying in the mosque. Dayniile District Police Commissioner told to the media that they arrested one suspect in connection to the incident. One elder was killed and another one was injured in the shooting. The Imam (the man who was leading the prayers) was also injured.

Armed clan clash flared up for the 2nd time in one week in Dhamase (110 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) on 01/07 between Muruule and Marehan sub-clans. Reports indicate that 12 combatants from both sides were killed and a score of other were injured.  So far no clan negotiations are reported and both sides are said to re-group.

Two groups of Marehan sub clans (not named) clash for several hours in Garbaharey. Apparently, the infighting was triggered by the killing of a business woman yesterday by a soldier who seemingly has killed already 2 more people in the previous year. Tensions are escalating between the sub-clans of the victim and perpetrator. Causalities not known.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled some hand grenades against a police station in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood in Beled Weyne on 01/07. Two police officers sustained injuries and the attackers managed to escape.

Two gunmen hailing from Majerteen and Dhulbahante clans exchanged gunfire over unspecified personal dispute in an area near Hargeisa bus station in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 01/07. A bystander man from Dhulbahante was killed by a stray bullet while the Dhulbahante gunman was also injured. No arrest was made.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNA personnel manning a checkpoint in the vicinity of Mushaani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 01/07. The SNA personnel were forced to withdraw after few minutes of fire exchange, though it is not clear if al Shabaab gained any or all control of the village. Causalities not known.
Unknown assailants armed with pistols shot and killed a famous elder in Bulgari neighbourhood who was on his way to his residence on 01/07. The perpetrators managed to escape.

More than hundreds of people mostly, drivers and conductors of commuter buses staged a peaceful demonstration in western part of Burco against the city mayor and the local councillors on 01/07. The protestors were complaining against a directive issued by the local municipal council allowing tricycles (Tuktuk) to play same routes as of the public buses. The drivers reportedly blocked the roads with their buses. Police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of protesters.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA outpost in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the morning of 02/07. The fighting lasted for few minutes before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Abu Hureyra Mosque of Bakara Market in the morning of 02/07. The reason for the killing remains unclear. Perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a government official in Afgooye on 02/07.

A gunmen from Dhulbahante/Jama Siyaad sub clan and Habar Younis/Sacad Younis sub clan reportedly exchanged a sudden burst of gunfire in Guumays village (45km E of Caynabo) in the evening of 02/07. This follows when the gunmen from Jama Siyaad sub clan started to fire to the gunmen of SacadYounis who arrived at that time in the village teashops. The motive of the shooting remains unknown but is believed to be related a revenge killings. Two men from the Sacad Younis clan were reportedly killed and three were injured. Three battalion of the Somaliland troops were immediately deployed to create buffer zone and prevent further attacks from both sides.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and injured a SNG soldier in Dabakaayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 03/07. Attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' position in the vicinity of livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 03/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

SNG forces opened fire on a civilian vehicle in the vicinity of Xero Gaadiid (Cabdicasiis District) in the night of 03/07. The driver, reportedly working with an international aid agency but off duty at that time and driving a private car, was injured in the shooting. The motive behind the shooting is unknown.

A JL soldier shot and killed a colleague in a dispute in a location 8 KM north 0f Kismayo in the morning of 03/07. JL forces were sent to arrest the killer but so far, no arrest was reported. Cause of the dispute unknown.
An IED was targeting a JLF vehicle convoy in Yoontoy Yare (27 KM NE of Kismayo) on 03/07. Four JL soldiers are reported dead and five more injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Following the retreat of AMISOM forces from Qoryoley al Shabaab overtakes the village. No report of violence.

Herders from Dhulbahante and Majerteen sub-clans briefly exchanged gunfire in the area of Arooley village (44km S of Taleex) on 03/07. The clash lasted for about an hour after which both militias retreated from the scene. The motive of the clash remains unknown and no casualties were reported. Pro-Puntland forces with battle wagons were reportedly deployed to disperse and create buffer zone between two warring herders.

Two groups of Puntland forces exchanged gunfire at a customs office 60km N of Qardho in the evening of 04/07. The motive of the clash is unknown. However, the incident is believed to be related to a dispute between the two groups. One soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.
Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade attack at JLF foot patrol and have injured one soldier at Umburitori, Fanole neighbourhood of Kismaayo town on 04/07 night. No other casualties reported.

Hundreds of residents in Bacaadweyn staged a demonstration against the president of SNG, Speaker of Parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia in the morning of 04/07. Local officials and elders who addressed the rally called on Puntland government to cut all relations with the SNG.

A man from Dhulbahante shot and injured the police commander of Fiqi Fuliye's police post in Ceerigaabo in the evening of 04/07. The motive is currently unclear. The victim also hails from Dhulbahnate clan. The perpetrator escaped.

An unidentified gunman believed to be Galgala/al Shabaab fighter opened fire and injured two women and a man in a teashop in Midigale village (74km S of Laas-Qoray) in the evening of 04/07. The motive of the attack is unknown and the perpetrator escaped.

Well-armed al Shabaab fighters entered into Wanlaweyne town in the evening of 04/07 after the SNG forces withdrew from the town towards Ballidoogle base. The al Shabaab militants withdrew voluntarily from the town about mid-night and went back to their locations.
A RCIED was targeting a SNG vehicle in the vicinity of Mudul-Braawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the evening of 04/07. The explosion reportedly damaged the vehicle but human casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters and nomads engaged in an armed clash in Babweyne (44 KM NE of Hudur) on 05/07. The conflict broke out over confiscated livestock, taken by al Shabaab. Three al Shabaab fighters and two local pastoralists were killed and SNGF sent re-enforcement to Babweyne in support of the locals.

An IED believed to be magnetic that was attached to a vehicle exploded in the vicinity of Ceel-Gaabta neighbourhood (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the morning of 05/07. A NISA officer who was driving the targeted vehicle sustained injuries. No other casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman in Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the morning of 05/07. The victim used to run a small scale business in Nasteexo neighbourhood. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Perpetrators escaped with a motorbike they were riding.

Armed gun-men attacked a busy Qat market in Jalalaqsi where people were chewing in the evening of 05/07. In the surprise attack, a gun-man opened fire and managed to kill one soldier and injured two more and two civilians. Further reports indicate that the gun-man also threw two hand grenades which did not explode. The attacker, thought to be al Shabaab member managed to escape from the scene with the help of others. SNG soldiers arrived at the location after 20 minutes and opened fire in the air to disperse gathered people.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Armed al Shabaab fighters launched attack against AMISOM/SNA positions in Mahadaay (21 KM NE of Jowhar) in the night of 05/07. The attackers managed to enter into the town but after almost one hour of gun fire exchange they were pushed back by AMISOM and SNA forces. Casualties from both sides are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters took over Buufow Bacaad (5 KM NW of Merca) after attacking a SNGF base in the village on 05/07. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be pro-Khatumo militia shot and killed a Somaliland army officer and injured another in Kalabaydh village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 05/07. The two victims are from Dhulbahante/Jama Siyaad sub-clan and Habarjeclo clan respectively. The motive of the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped. Somaliland forces conducted a security operation in the outskirts of the village following the attack but no arrests were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG police forces on patrol in Caafi Mineral Water Factory area in the night of 06/07. After exchanging gun fire for around 20 minutes al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A SNG officer, working for the Ministry of Finance was shot and killed by armed unknown men with pistols on 06/07. The perpetrators managed to escape. A second officer and two soldiers were killed in a drive-by shooting along the industrial road, also in Hawl Wadaag.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNG army out-post near the perfume factory in the night of 06/07. After exchanging gun-fire for 10 minutes suspected al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab shot and killed an ENDF defector, who was previously shown to the public in Ufurow in Hubay (30 KM south of Qansax Dheere on 06/07. The reason is unclear but some sources indicate that he was shot after he tried to escape from al Shabaab forces.

A SNG soldier threw a hand grenade into a crowd of civilians at the market close to Sheikh Ibrahim building in Isha neighbourhood on 06/07. He also immediately opened fire at civilians and other SNGF. Hospital sources report to have received 3 dead and 12 injured civilian, some of them serious. The perpetrator first managed to escape heavy gun-fire from other SNGF but was soon apprehended and arrested at the outskirts of the town. The motive of the soldier, working for the SNA General's unit is so far unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNA base in Laantabuur (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 06/07. Both sides engaged in heavy exchange of gunfire for twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers were pushed back. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and two SNA soldiers got injured.

A gunman from Habarjeclo/Soolomadaw sub-clan shot and killed a man from Habarjeclo/Omar sub-clan and injured another in Habari Heshay village on 06/07 following a dispute over water reservoirs. Habarjeclo/Omar sub-clan retaliated and killed a man from Soolomadaw sub-clan. Tensions run high in Adhiboob near Habar Heshay village after both sub-clans reportedly mobilized their clan militia. Reports indicate that Somaliland deployed a large number of its troops to prevent further clashes between the two sides.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Suuq Boocle neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the evening of 07/07. The motive behind the killing is not known. Unconfirmed report indicated that the attackers were also SNG soldier who were looking after the victim over undisclosed reasons. Perpetrators escaped.

An IED believed to be magnetic that was attached to a Toyota Noah detonated in the vicinity of Walaalaha Pharmacy (Karaan District) in the morning of 07/07.  The target is still not clear but initial reports indicate that the victim was a land broker. The motive behind the attack is not known. No group claimed the responsibility of the attack. Two men were killed in the explosion and four bystanders were injured.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a tax collector in Dabakaya Madow neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the afternoon of 07/07. Perpetrators escaped.

A public civilian driver was shot and killed while driving his car by unidentified gunmen at the main bridge entrance of Buur-Hakaba town. The motive behind the killing is not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Resident community including women, children, young people, and elderly carried out a peaceful demonstration voicing concerns about insecurity and instability in the town after violent incidents against civilian occurred previously in the town. Demonstrators used slogans of security, stability demands from the local authorities. Gedo region governor Maxamed Cabdi Kaliil and Iiman CadbowKaarshe Garbaharey district commissioner addressed the demonstrators on their demand for security, peace and stability.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in Bacadada, Hawl-wadaag of Beled Weyne neighbourhood on 07/07. The exchange of gunfire lasted for around 5 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. So far, no casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed two men on motorcycles in Buur Weyn (29 KM S of Bulo Burte) in the night of 07/07. They were on their way, transporting khat to Bulo Burte. In the confrontation, one man was wounded and the second man was arrested by al Shabaab. Their motorbikes were also confiscated and nothing is known on their fate.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Sheekh Abroone in the morning of 07/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire and immediately conducted security operation in the neighbourhood. A large number of people were arrested during the operation. One civilian was killed by AMISOM forces who said she was intending to throw another hand grenade at them and two other civilian bystanders were wounded by stray bullets.

Wadajir/Medina District Police and SNA personnel manning a checkpoint near the Jazeera Military Training Centre fought over the control of the checkpoint in the afternoon of 08/07. The incident happened after Wadajir DC instructed the SNA personnel to leave the checkpoint, a call denied by the SNA soldiers on the checkpoint. Two SNA soldiers were killed and three others were injured. It is not clear which group maintained control of the checkpoint.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a NISA Officer in the vicinity of Geed Jacayl (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 08/07. The victim was reportedly heading to his home when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.
A vehicle, belonging to Waaberi local authorities exploded in the afternoon of 08/07. Three people were injured in the explosion.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base on the west side of Jalalaqsi Town in the night of 08/07. Both sides exchanged fire for 20 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attacker armed with a pistol shot and killed former Afgooye DC Mr. Abdullahi Abdi Iidey in the vicinity of Dhagaxtuur in the afternoon of 08/07. The victim responded with gunshot before he died and injured the perpetrator.
Gunmen armed with pistols have killed a government soldier in Mogadishu's Hodan District on the evening of 09/07.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 09/07. The victims were buying khat when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped.

A gunmen from Dhulbahante/Wacays Aden sub clan reportedly shot and killed herder man from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub clan near Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) in the afternoon of 09/07. The incident is related to cycles of revenge killings between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators reportedly took away an AK-47 belonging to the victim and escaped.

A group of youth orphans from an orphanage centre in Jigjiga Yar neighbourhood in Kood-Buur district attacked other youth group in the neighbourhood using sticks, daggers and stones on 09/07. The attacking youth destroyed windows of houses i while disturbed the residents in the area. The clash was triggered a dispute over the ownership of a playground in front of the orphanage centre, the youth from the centre claim that it's their ground while the other group insist that it's a public ground.  Forces from custodial corps who were also responsible of the orphanage centre arrived at the scene and shot at the air to separate the two groups. A stray bullet hit a youth from the attacking group and seriously injured him while also arresting some others from the same group.
Police disperse two rioting youth groups. Some of the rioters sustain gunshot injuries.

A VBIED detonated in front of the Siyaad Hotel (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the evening of 10/07. The explosion was followed by serious exchange of gunfire between the hotel guards/ SNP force and the al Shabaab attackers. Reports show that the attackers were seven in number including the suicide. Security forces reinforced the scene and closed the whole area. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the attackers were aiming at Hotel SYL which is adjacent to Siyaad Hotel and that they diverted to Siyaad when the SYL Hotel guards fired them very seriously. Numbers of dead not known.

Around five al Shabaab attackers launched a complex attack against Wehliye Hotel (Hawl-Wadaag District) and along the busy Maka Al Mukarama road in the evening of 10/07. The attack started with a car explosion (VBIED) followed by exchange of gunfire between the al Shabaab attackers on one side and the SNG forces and the hotel guards on the other side.  The attackers did not manage to enter the hotel due to fierce resistant which was coming from the SNG forces/ Hotel guards. The fighting lasted for one hour and twenty minutes after which the security forces killed all the attackers and restored the order. Five people were killed in the attack and roughly ten others were injured. The four al Shabaab attackers were also killed. Two Federal MPs are among the injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attackers shelled at least four mortar rounds at AMISOM base inside Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 10/07. Another two mortar shells also landed in the vicinity of Villa Somalia. SNG did not release any statement on the mortar attack. The mortars are believed to be fired from the outskirts of Mogadishu. Casualties are unknown.

AMISOM supported local militia in Bulo Burto called Macawisley left Bulo Burto and attacked Tardo in the evening of 10/07. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and their guns were taken. After the armed confrontation, the militia went to Jalalaqsi where they were welcomed by LA.  It seems a new strategy that AMISOM is supporting and equipping local militia in their fight against al Shabaab.

Unknown perpetrators shot and seriously wounded an Imam, who was entering the mosque for Tahajud prayers in Nur Xawaad neighbourhood on 10/07. The perpetrator managed to escape and the Imam was rushed to the hospital. The motive is unknown.

Unidentified attacker armed with a pistol shot and killed one off-duty JLF soldier in front of his house after the Ramadan break in Shaqaalaha neighbourhood in the night of 10/07. The perpetrator escaped from the scene and no arrests reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF supply convoy in Boodaan (50 KM SE of Yeed) on 11/07. Both sides exchange small arms fire and RPGs. Casualties from the incident is not yet known as the telecommunication network in the area including Wajid town is switched off for the last two days.

Suspected al Shabaab members threw 2 hand grenades against the house of ISWA Deputy Minister of Husbandry and previous Deputy DC on 11/07. No casualties were reported during the explosion. SNGF responded with gun-fire, killing one of the attackers and injuring a second man, who was handed over to the police after receiving medical treatment in the hospital.

An off-duty SNG soldier who was walking home alone was shot and killed in Hawo-Tako, outside Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 11/07 by unidentified gunmen. The motive is unknown and the perpetrator escaped from the scene. No arrest was reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Ceel-Jaale (7km SW of Marka) and SNA forces collided mistakenly after the AMISOM forces thought that the SNA forces were al Shabaab fighters. The SNA forces came from Shalaambood and they were heading to Marka when the incident happened. Two SNA soldiers were killed and five others were injured. One of the SNA vehicles was also damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against AMISOM forces on foot patrol inside Marka town in the morning of 11/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire to different directions after the blast. Confirmed reports indicate that AMISOM forces entered a mosque (Al-Raxmah) and killed the imam and his assistant inside the mosque. The indiscriminate gunfire opened by AMISOM forces also injured six civilians. Tensions turned high and people took the streets of Marka to show their anger against AMISOM forces' behaviour towards the civilians. The demonstrators were burning tyres and they had slogans saying AMISOM has to leave. The demonstration was continuing until 15:00.

Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against AMISOM forces on foot patrol inside Marka town in the morning of 11/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire to different directions after the blast. Confirmed reports indicate that AMISOM forces entered a mosque (Al-Raxmah) and killed the imam and his assistant inside the mosque. The indiscriminate gunfire opened by AMISOM forces also injured six civilians. Tensions turned high and people took the streets of Marka to show their anger against AMISOM forces' behaviour towards the civilians. The demonstrators were burning tyres and they had slogans saying AMISOM has to leave. The demonstration was continuing until 15:00.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against AMISOM forces on foot patrol inside Marka town in the morning of 11/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire to different directions after the blast. Confirmed reports indicate that AMISOM forces entered a mosque (Al-Raxmah) and killed the imam and his assistant inside the mosque.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters and allied forces clashed briefly in Buur Dhuxunle, (60 KM SE of Yeed) on 12/07. After exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters escaped. One civilian was killed in the exchange and 2 SNGF were injured. After the attack, ENDF/SNG also left the town.

Unidentified armed men in a vehicle killed Kaxda District Secretary and two of his guards in drive by shooting in the vicinity of Dabakaaya Madow (Dharkeynley District) in the morning of 12/07. The attackers escaped from the scene.

NISA and SNA personnel fought in the vicinity of Tarabuunka (Hodan District) over unknown dispute in the afternoon of 12/07. One NISA soldier was killed and one SNA member was injured during the clash.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An ENDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Aawdiinle (30 KM NE of Baidoa) on 12/07. One casualty was reported on ENDF side who was transferred to hospital for treatment.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF convoy was targeted with an IED, which exploded in Qansax Dheere shortly before the convoy reached the place on 12/07. No casualties were reported. All communication was switched off in Baidoa since early morning as a ENDF convoy left from Baidoa for Burhakaba.
Two groups of Marehan militia fought over extorted money in the afternoon of 12/07. One man was killed, another one wounded and the shooter managed to escape from the scene.

A box with a mobile phone attached was placed close to Dahabshiil Bank in Cadado Town on 12/07. A civilian tried to pick the phone and the box exploded damaging his hand. The motive is unknown and no other casualty was reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Reports confirm that KDF conducted an airstrike against Dhamase village (103 KM NW of Buulo Xaawo) in the early morning of 12/07.  Residents report that at least 10 people are reported to have been killed including children who were in Holy Quran School.  Dhamase is under control of al Shabaab but usually has no permanent presence in the village and clan clashes between Murule and Marehan are reported in the area.  The reason is unclear why KDF bombed the village. KDF also bombed Nus Dariiq (83 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) and Laan Qurac (76 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) was bombarded and civilian casualties and livestock death were reported.

Intelligence JL forces attacked JL security forces from the Minister of Interior and Security in Calanley neighbourhood, close to the Ministry. Villagers are reporting heave gun-fire is used. Apparently during the disarmament process, a soldier from the Minister of interior confiscated a gun from the Intelligence forces and refused to render it back. Casualties are unknown as the fighting was on-going during the reporting time.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed one of the Afgooye sub district officials in the Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye town) in the evening of 12/07. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

A demonstration in protest against an alleged allocation of land belonging to Berbera port to businessmen was held near the port of Berbera on 12/07. The demonstration follows after workers started to construct a new building near the port, which local media claimed was given to the businessman by the government. A number of local business people were part of the demonstrators. The demonstrators tried to stop the construction by throwing some stones at the construction workers. They also called on the port manager to stop the allocation of state-owned land to the businessmen. Police dispersed the demonstrators and arrested a number of then.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy in War Dhujiiley (56 KM SE of Yeed) on 13/07. Both sides exchanged small arms fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two civilians were killed and 2 SNGF were injured during the fight.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' base in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in night of 13/07. Casualties are unknown.

SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire with two SNG personnel who were extorting money from the public transport in the vicinity of Ceelgaabta (Xamar Jab Jab District) on 13/07. The two soldiers escaped. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against NISA outpost in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 13/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out attack against Yaaqshiid District Police Station in the night of 13/07. The police force exchanged gunfire with the attackers for a while before the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. One soldier was killed and another one injured during the fight while three al Shabaab fighters were also injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 rounds of mortars against AMISOM base in Qansax Dheere in the early morning of 13/07. No casualties were reported and the attackers withdrew.

Two militia groups from Habar-Gidir (Suleiman and Ary sub-clans) clashed in Camaara village (70km W of Hobyo) on 13/07. The motive of the clash is believed to be clan revenge between the two sides.  Traditional elders and clerics have stepped in to defuse the hostilities between the fighting groups; however the two sides are still mobilizing their militias. Three militias from Suleiman were killed while unknown numbers of militias from both sides were injured.

Well-armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA bases in Rage-Ceelle town (47km NE of Warsheikh) in the morning of 13/07. After a heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for more than twenty minutes the al Shabaab militants managed to take-over the town.  SNA forces retreated to AMISOM base in the outskirt of the town. Casualties reported are so far 8 SNGF and 4 civilians, al Shabaab side is unknown. Heavier casualties reported from other sources.
Following a take-over of Raga Ceel by al Shabaab, al Shabaab exits and SNG forces again gain control of the town.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG police based near the Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 14/07. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a NISA soldier in the vicinity of Cinema Mogadishu (Wadajir District) in the night of 14/07. Unconfirmed reports stated that the victim was recently appointed for Marka intelligence chief. Attackers escaped.

A group of unidentified attackers armed with pistols attacked SNG soldier in Garas Balley locality (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 14/07. The soldier defended himself against the attackers and he survived.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF military operations against Al-Shabaab were continuing in Qansax Dheere and surrounding villages in the morning of 14/07. Mortar fire is heard outside Qansax Dheere.  ENDF forces shelled Bulo Gumar village (8 km and Buulo-Masaajid 10Km SW of Qansax Dheere) respectively, said to be military bases for al Shabaab. The artillery/mortar attack from ENDF hit a house in Buulo Gumar Village where two children and their mother were killed; in Buulo-Masaajid village no injuries/dead were reported.

A man from the Galjeel sub-clan shot and killed a man from the Jejeele sub-clan for unknown reason in Hawl-wadaag section in the afternoon of 14/07. Other armed Jejeele clan members immediately chased after the killer and shot and killed him. The killing and revenge killing caused tension in Hawl-wadaag section and more clan clashes can be anticipated.  Further reports indicate that, elders went into negotiations and the 2 bodies were exchanged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNGF base in Bulo Burte in the night of 14/07 and fired also a mortar round. After both sides exchanged gun-fire for around an hour, al Shabaab fighters retreated. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen hailing from Marehan/Wagardhac shot and killed two men hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad near Laanwaaley village (40km SW of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 14/7. The motive of the killing is allegedly related with previous clan revenge between the two sub-cans.  The killing has generated tension in the area. No other casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire in Laanta Buuro (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 14/04 over the collection of money extorted from public vehicles. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Ethiopian and al Shabaab forces engage in an hour-long battle near Wajid. Ten al Shabaab fighter believed killed in the fighting.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces' based in former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 15/07. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a taxi driver in the vicinity of Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 15/07.The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A KDF convoy was targeted with a RCIED near Ceel Cadde (51KM SW of Garbahaarey on 15/07. One KDF vehicle was damaged but casualties are unknown. The convoy was heading from Dhamase to Ceel Cadde.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A KDF convoy was hit by an IED planted on the road close to Likooley village. The convoy was travelling from Ceel Cadde to Wajiir through Dhamase. One vehicle was damaged. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA forces' base outside Afgooye town in the night of 15/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No casualties reported.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint in the vicinity of Mushaani village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 15/07. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 15/07. The explosion reportedly missed the target as the device exploded after the convoy passed. No casualties were reported.
During a handing over ceremony, a security guard of the former DC opened fire and injured a SNGF guarding the site.

ASNG soldier opened gunfire against a group of people who were receiving humanitarian food aid in the District Office (Xamar Weyne) in the morning of 16/07. An Arab NGO was distributing food and clothes to the people in need with the help of the district authority. A district official who talked to the media stated that the gunfire was unintentional. One civilian was killed and another was injured. The soldier was arrested.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Joint KDF/SNGF advanced closer to Bardheere in the night of 15/07 and took over Taraka village (49 KM SW of Bardheere) after exchanging artillery fire with al Shabaab fighters. It is unknown if the joint forces will remain in the village or proceed towards Bardheere in line with the Juba Corridor Offensive. Taraka is a strategic location which links Bardheere with Ceel Waaq and Kenya.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: Suspected drone strike, later revealed as originating from the United States, targeted a vehicle with Senior al Shabaab members on board in Jungal Village (23 KM NW of Bardheere) in the early morning of 16/07. Thirty suspected causalities, some reports declare 51 (The Star, Nairobi). Unconfirmed reports indicate that the drone strike was targeting a vehicle with Ismail Jabhad and Ismail Dheere, two Senior al Shabaab military commanders on board.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy, which was travelling between Tayeeglow and Ceel Garas in Ceel Gudo (20 KM NW of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 16/07. Reports indicate that 4 al Shabaab fighters were killed while four others were caught alive. ENDF casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA post in Sarta Qabyada in the evening of 16/07. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for around 10 minutes before al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a tax collector in Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 16/07.
A government soldier shot and killed a traveller over non-payment of extortion money.
ASWJ fighters ambushed SNG police in the Xananbure area (40 KM SE of Cadud Waaq). Seven SNG police men were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA forces based in Gol-Weyn after mid-night on 17/07. The fighting was going on until 05:00 in morning. SNA forces in Shalaambood and Buulo Mareer sent reinforcement troops to Gol-Weyn early in the morning but they were both ambushed by al Shabaab fighters on their way to Gol-Weyn. Six SNA soldiers were killed while al Shabaab fighters lost 16.

Ceel Cilaan village (46 KM NW of Diinsoor) was bombarded by air by anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), targeting al Shabaab vehicles. Unconfirmed reports indicate that both civilians and al Shabaab fighters were killed or injured during the strike, exact numbers not known.
Residents protest against forced evictions in Hodan evictions.
Residents protest the killing of a traveller by a SNG soldier the previous day.
Al Shabaab fighters executed an al Shabaab fighter, accused of spying and relaying information to ENDF/SNGF in Baardheere.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Baar Ubax (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 18/07. Perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF took over Ufurow (18 KM SW of Qansax Dheere) on 18/07. As of 19/07 al Shabaab are back in town after joint forces continued with their military operation towards Diinsoor. No violence reported in either transfer.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: A suspected US drone strike reportedly attacked a vehicle carrying the acting Intelligence al Shabaab officer in Adad-Gurey (30 KM SW of Diinsoor) on 18/07. Causalities not known.
A SNGF vehicle was hit by an IED in Faaxfax Dhuun (75 KM SW of Baardheere) on 18/07. Two injuries reported.

A group of youth and businessmen demonstrated against the new mayor of Borama and the governor of Awdal region in Borama on 18/07. The protestors were unhappy over the local government's slow response following a recent fire breakout at the local market which destroyed several shops. Police arrived at the scene and arrested several teenagers who threw stones at the police.
ASWJ forces, after getting re-enforcement attacked SNGF base in Bangelle (20 KM SE of Cabud Waaq) in retaliation for the morning attack. Casualties from the second fight are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A SVBIED rammed into an ENDF convoy and SNFG troops heading to Diinsoor district in Dharqo (45 KM SW of Baidoa) on 19/07.  Two SNGF died in the attack but 6 killed ENDF cannot be verified.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an ENDF/SNGF convoy in Eesow, (approx. 49 KM east of Diinsoor) in the afternoon of 19/07. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF/SNG convoy near Idale (58 KM SW of Baidoa) in the evening of 19/07. Both sides exchanged small arms fire before al Shabaab fighters retreated. Two SNGF are reported to be killed.

Fighting broke out between ASWJ and SNGF in Laandheer village (approx. 18 KM SE of Cabud Waaq) in the morning of 19/07. After heavy fighting, ASWJ lost 5 of their soldiers before both sides retreated for re-enforcement.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A SVBIED rammed into an ENDF convoy in Lulaaye (40 KM SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 19/07. Casualties are unknown.

ENDF/SNGF took over Ufurow (18 KM SW of Qansax Dheere) on 18/07. As of 19/07 al Shabaab are back in town after joint forces continued with their military operation towards Diinsoor. No violence reported in either transfer.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF and al Shabaab clash in Ceel Cilaan. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF on security operation took over Moro Gabey (28 KM NW of Hudur) and Garas Weyne (47 KM NW of Hudur) in the afternoon of 20/07. In both villages ENDF/SNGF were confronted by al Shabaab fighters but "no serious fighting" was reported before the allied forces took over the villages. Casualties are unknown.
