NOTES: ENDF/SNGF on security operation took over Moro Gabey (28 KM NW of Hudur) and Garas Weyne (47 KM NW of Hudur) in the afternoon of 20/07. In both villages ENDF/SNGF were confronted by al Shabaab fighters but "no serious fighting" was reported before the allied forces took over the villages. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF took over the control of Rama Caddey (50 KM SW of Diinsoor) in the afternoon of 20/07. Both sides exchanged gun-fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village. No causalities reported from either sides.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy in Buur Dhuxunley (60 KM SE of Yeed) on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that there were al Shabaab and civilian casualties but the exact number is unknown. Additional reports add that ENDF were supported by Lieui police during the fight.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An IED was hidden in the bush at the road side in Ceel Cilaan village (46km NW of Diinsoor) and exploded as ENDF engineering team were searching the area for explosives on 20/07 injuring 6 ENDF soldiers. After the explosion al Shabaab fighters engaged in small arms fire with ENDF resulting in the death of 2 al Shabaab fighters and one taken alive.

Controversial reports indicate that ASWJ has taken over the control of Cabud Waaq in the afternoon of 20/07 while other reports say that local militia, who are ASWJ sympathizers took over the police station in town. Violence not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF took over Kulunjerer (40 KM NE of Wajiid) in the afternoon of 20/07. No armed confrontation was reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Allied forces conducted airstrikes in Bisiq Cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) and Barariya (28 KM SE of Buur Hakaba) before noon on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the target were al Shabaab fighters, travelling from Diinsoor into Buur Hakaba District. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Allied forces conducted airstrikes in Bisiq Cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) and Barariya (28 KM SE of Buur Hakaba) before noon on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the target were al Shabaab fighters, travelling from Diinsoor into Buur Hakaba District. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An air strike against al Shabaab fighters was conducted in Doodaale village (79 KM SW of Buur Hakaba on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that some al Shabaab fighters were killed and a battle wagon destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Cambarey Village (45km SW of Marka) in the morning of 20/07. One of the AMISOM vehicles was damaged by the explosion. Human casualties are unknown.
A RCIED exploded in Ivo the ex-central bank in Sahara neighbourhood in the afternoon of 20/07. It is an open area and no casualties were reported.

Hundreds of worshipers from Al Huda mosque staged demonstration in Sheikh Bashir neighbourhood (Burco) on 20/07 in protest against a bill-board installed by Somaliland Ministry of Labour and Family Affairs in partnership with a UN agency campaigning for gender balance in the town.
Unidentified gunmen kill a senior government intelligence officer in Dharkeynley.

Armed unknown men with pistols shot and killed an alleged NISA informant in Suuq Yare neighbourhood (Dharkeynley) in the morning of 20/07. It is believed that his information led to the arrest of al Shabaab members. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Presidential security guards physically assaulted three local journalists who attempt to cover the departure of SNG prime minister, Umar Abdirashid Ali, from Galkacyo airport on 20/07. The soldiers also reportedly damaged the equipment of the journalists.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNA convoy in the vicinity of Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the morning of 21/07. Two civilian bystanders were reportedly injured during the gunfire exchange.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNGF convoy in Raamacadey (approx. 80 KM SW of Baidoa on 21/07. Serious fighting broke out between the two parties until al Shabaab forces withdrew. AMISOM/SNGF is still in the location in the morning of 22/07. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM jets on 21/07 launched air raids against Al-Shabaab camps in areas near the town of Dinsor in southern Somalia. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF forces conduct an airstrike against al Shabaab in Jungal on 21/07. Shabelle Media Network reports 51 deaths. US forces launched a drone strike in the area on 16/07.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM convoy opened fire against 3 public buses in SOS neighbourhood in the afternoon of 21/07. The motive is unknown and one student died while unknown number was injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces conducted a search and security operation in Baytaruus neighbourhood to flash out suspected al Shabaab elements in the morning of 21/07. The forces did house to house searches and recovered some guns. The operation went out of hand after some people were shot and killed by AMISOM in their houses and other inhabitants also opened fire. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 13 civilians (some sources claim 19) were killed and around 20 wounded during the operation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF and al Shabaab clash in Ceel Cilaan for a third consecutive day. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF take over Safar Nooley near Dinsoor in the morning of 21/07. No report of violence or resistance.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM-SNG forces battle al Shabaab in several areas of Xudur district, overtaking Mura-gabe, Garas-wayne and Lagalay. Seventeen al Shabaab deaths reported among the three areas.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM-SNG forces battle al Shabaab in several areas of Xudur district, overtaking Mura-gabe, Garas-wayne and Lagalay. Seventeen al Shabaab deaths reported among the three areas.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF took over Muqakoor (67 KM NE of Bulo Burte) from an unknown or unreported power on 22/07. Exact details and number of casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF took over Wabxo (50 KM NW of Bulo Burte) from an unknown power on 22/07. Exact details and number of casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM-SNG forces battle al Shabaab in several areas of Xudur district, overtaking Mura-gabe, Garas-wayne and Lagalay. Seventeen al Shabaab deaths reported among the three areas. One soldier died during the operation.

Reports indicate that four men armed with AK 47 attacked Qulateyn (Intelligence base)  near Hormuud Telecom  in Calanley neighbourhood  of Kismaayo town on 22/07 and JLF at the base responded to the attackers, after brief exchange of gun fire, the attackers managed to escape into a civilian house near the base and are surrounded by JLF. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: SNGF/JLF allied with KDF/ENDF/AMISOM took over Bardheere Town in the afternoon of 22/07. No fighting was reported since al Shabaab vacated the town in anticipation of allied forces advance without major resistance. Bardheere was under control of al Shabaab since 2009.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Reports indicate that KDF and ENDF forces using helicopters bombarded the outskirts of Bardheere to provide air support to the advancing AMISOM/SNGF troops. Casualties are unknown.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Hobyo on 22/07 to express their support to the newly elected Galmudug president, Abdikarim Hussein Gulled. Local officials, elders and the residents requested the president to support the construction of Hobyo seaport.

A civilian man was shot and killed by unknown men armed with pistols, the killing comes after tension and al Shabaab troops movement continues in the town of Baardheere due to the on-going Juba Corridor Offensive. The motive behind the murder is no known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Upon the liberation and arrival of allied pro-government forces two civilians were shot and killed on suspicion of affiliation with al Shabaab.
Prior to the arrival of pro-government allied forces to Baardheere, al Shabaab killed a civilian on their exit.

A civilian man was shot and killed by another civilian man in Gafay Village (8km NE of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 22/07 over dispute of farmland ownership. Both the victim and the perpetrator hail from the same clan (Jareer Weyne/Shiidle).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF attacked Siji village (approx. 67 KM SE of Yeed on 22/07. After an exchange of gun fire, al Shabaab fighter withdrew from the village. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed and no other casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF/Lieu Police took over Labaatan Jirow (48 KM NE of Baidoa) after an armed confrontation in the outskirts of the village. Four al Shabaab fighters are said to have been killed. It is not known if the forces are planning to stay in the village or will move to another village.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG force's base in the outskirt of Afgooye town in the morning of 23/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Unconfirmed reports indicate that ENDF forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters and former al Shabaab Baidoa district court chairman was killed in Buur Dhuxunle (59 KM SE of Yeed)

ASWJ supporters and former police-men send militia take charge of a police station. This move angered Galmudug supporters, who equally mobilized their militia and attacked the police station in the evening of 23/07. Around two combatants were killed and 6 others wounded.

Armed al Shabaab fighters attacked a group of SNG soldiers who were manning an illegal checkpoint in the vicinity of Cumar-Beere village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the morning of 23/07. Casualties are unknown.

Reports indicate that two bodies were found beheaded in the outskirts of Labaatan Jirow (48 KM NE of Baidoa) in the evening of 23/07. The motive is said that al Shabaab sentenced the two man to death for spying for the enemy.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against police outpost in Ciise Cabdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 23/07. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces' base in the vicinity of Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 23/07. After a brief armed clash, the attackers withdrew. No reports on casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNAF/ISWA forces took over Diinsoor from al Shabaab without resistance. It is not clear if al Shabaab had vacated the village prior to the AMISOM advance.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNA convoy was ambushed between Buufow Bacaad and Shalaambood (Marka District) in the morning of 24/07. Both sides engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the attackers disappeared. Casualties of both sides are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy was targeted with a RCIED in Xaawo Cabdi on 24/07. Perpetrators escaped and no casualties were reported; vehicle damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Attack helicopters (ENDF) launched an airstrike against Dalan Doole village (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 24/07. Reports indicate that around 15 civilians were killed and some al Shabaab vehicles destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Attack helicopters (ENDF) bombarded Sigle (approx. 75 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) late afternoon of 24/07. The village was bombarded after some al Shabaab fled from Dalan Doole (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba). Reports indicate that many civilians including women and children are killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Joint ENDF/SNGF took over Ufurow (18 KM SW of Qansax Dheere) in the morning of 25/07. It is the second time in two weeks that Ufurow is changing hands as ENDF/SNGF after taking over small villages are leaving usually after 2 days again. No casualties were reported.

Fighting broke out between al Shabaab and new police from zone 5 (Somalia Ethiopian) in Labaatan Jirow village (47Km NE of Baidoa) on 25/07.  Three al Shabaab members were killed and 20 other were apprehended, there has been population displacement trying to escape from the conflict violence that continue in this village against al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Around twenty al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNGF base in Muqakoor village (67 KM NE of Bulo Burte) early morning of 25/07. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two clan militia, both from Hawiye/Abgaal clashed over grazing land in Ceel-beeneed, outside Warshiikh on 25/07. The fight continued for around 2 hours and casualties are unknown.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Somali Civil Servant in Macalin Nuur neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) on 22/07. The victim was working for the Office of the Prime Minister. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers killed an MP in drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Korontada (Wadajir/Medina District) in the afternoon of 25/07. His driver and a guard were also killed by the attackers. The MP's name was Abdullahi Bantu. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

Allied forces attacked Carro-Case (33 KM SE of Belet Xaawo) on 26/07. Both sides used heavy weaponry before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three SNGF and seven al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.

SNG police forces exchanged gun-fire with SNGF at Gaalware (5 KM west of Afgooye) over an illegal check-point to rob passengers on 26/07. After a brief shoot-out, SNG police arrested two soldiers and other four managed to escape.

A small truck, laden with explosives detonated near the entrance gate of Jazeera Hotel on the airport road on 26/07. The huge explosion was followed by some gun-fire from hotel and other guards in the area. Initial reports indicate that at least 16 people (inside and outside the hotel) were killed and more than 20 were wounded. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A senior police officer was injured after unidentified gunmen opened fire at police conducting security operation along Professor Jimcaale Road in Garowe in the night of 26/07. The incident reportedly happened as police tried to separate the groups of women involved in scuffle over unknown reason. Police fired in the air to disperse the women but unidentified people responded by firing in the direction of the police, seriously injuring a senior police officer.

Al Shabaab executed a man by firing squad east of Bu'ale Town on 26/07 morning.  Al Shabaab Sharia law court said that the man, identified as Soomow Abdisalan, admitted of having killed innocent civilians mid 2014 in the vicinity of Bu'ale Town, the court did not give further details about the alleged killing.

JLF shot at a speeding Mini-bus that refused to stop while heading to the airport to attend the welcoming of the SNG president on 26/07. Three female civilian's at Barcaleen check point were injured and taken to Kismaayo hospital for medication.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF on security patrol went on Baad Cade Road (north of Baidoa) in the early morning of 27/07 to follow up on complains of illegal check-points set up by armed men dressed in military uniforms with the aim to rob civilians. On arrival, two of the present uniformed men at the illegal check-point were shot and killed while a third one was wounded after a short clash.

An armed clash reportedly erupted between the two sub-clans of Dhulbahante (Baharsame and Qayaad) near Dharkeyn Genyo Village (76km E of Buuhoodle)on 27/07 following prolonged disputes and revenge killing between the two sides.  The two sides exchanged fire for about an hour. Three combatants were killed (one from Baharsame clan  and two from Qayaad clan) while a number of others were injured. A group of elders from Laas Caanood went to the area to defuse the tension.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF forces shot and injured two Leysan militia men in Caragaduud (13 KM west of Baidoa) after mistaken them for al Shabaab fighters on 27/07. The injured men were brought to Baidoa hospital for further treatment.
Armed al Shabaab personnel launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the outskirt of Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/07. Casualties are unknown.

A group of Hargeisa University students attacked the university with stones in the morning of 27/07. The reason behind the attack is unclear but it is believed that the students were barred from doing examinations. The students damaged windows and a number of vehicles parked in the compound. Police shot in the air and dispersed the group. They also arrested 20 students. Six lecturers were injured in the incident.

Unidentified armed men believed to be al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a civilian man inside Janaale town (14 KM NW of Marka) in the evening of 27/07. The motive behind the killing is not known but unconfirmed reports suggest that the victim used to be a SNG soldier although he left the job long time before.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: "Dozens" of al Shabaab are killed in Jameco area just 20 kilometres west of Burhakaba in Bay region. AMISOM-ENDF was also able to overtake the town. Date not clear.

Militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad sub-clan reportedly ambushed Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud herders near Ballibusle (80 km SW of Jariiban) in the evening of 28/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the Sa'ad militias withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG forces fought inside Wanla Weyne town over dispute of extorted money from an illegal checkpoint in the morning of 28/07. Two SNG soldiers were injured by the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Warmahan (30km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 28/07. After a brief exchange of gunfire the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
An IED  targeted a NISA Officer in Yaaqshiid District in the morning of 27/07. The device is believed to be magnetic that was attached to the vehicle of the victim. The victim sustained injuries.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM-KDF forces battle al Shabaab near Baardheere, 24 reported enemy dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF launched an ambush against al Shabaab fighters close to Buur Cadey (37 KM SE of Rabdhure) on 29/07. Reports indicate that four al Shabaab fighters have been killed in the armed clash and no casualties were reported from the allied forces side.

A civilian man from Misra Village (10 KM SE of Diinsoor) killed an al Shabaab member with an axe on 29/07. Both are from Dabare sub-clan and the motive is said to be revenge for getting several times arrested, fined and mal treated by the al Shabaab fighter during the time, al Shabaab was in control. The perpetrator took the gun of the victim and escaped from the village to Diinsoor.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 29/07. Perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ISWA military and ENDF attacked Jameecadi Habardooy (11 KM SE of Baidoa) on 29/07. Both sides engaged in a gun battle which lasted more than 30 minutes before al Shabaab retreated into the bush. The armed clash was followed by an ENDF helicopter air bombing of the area. So far no casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in Rimaygacmeed (6 KM south of Afgooye) on 29/07. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for about five minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF attacked Siji village (approx. 40 KM SE of Rabdhure) on 29/07. Both sides engaged in a pro-longed gun battle until al Shabaab forces were forced to retreat. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed and their bodies displayed in the village. No other casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF/SNGF on military operation attacked Madaa village (25 KM SE of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 29/07. Al Shabaab/ONLF militia and ENDF/SNGF engaged in a prolonged fight before Al Shabaab/ONLF fled from the village, being persuaded by ENDF/SNGF. First information indicates that six al Shabaab fighters, five ONLF militias were killed in the attack and one al Shabaab fighters was captured alive. ENDF/SNAF also captured one PKM, four RPGs and some other small arms fire and ammunitions. It is not clear if the ENDF gained control of the village.

An armed clash between two groups of clan militia reignited again in Ceel-beeneed (22 KM NW of Warsheikh) in the morning of 29/07. The two groups (both Abgal) are fighting over crazing land. After more than 6 hours of sporadic fighting, twelve people from both sides are reported killed while more got injured. Elders are trying to de-escalate the situation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF attack helicopters bombarded Daudow village (6 KM S of Baidoa) in the morning of 29/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 9 al Shabaab fighters were wounded together with two civilians.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).
An anti-Puntland rally was held in Buuhoodle on 29/07 in protest against the presence of Puntland revenue authority and their forces who are recently involving tax collection in the region.

Three armed men hailing from Abgal/Da'ud shot and killed farmers from Hawiye/Moblen over a disputed piece of land in Cadayga Moobleen (10 KM NW of Balcad) in the morning of 29/07. Numbers unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported or clan elder intervention.
Mdantsane residents protest and burn debris after being left without electricity or water for a week.
Residents of Wells Estate in Port Elizabeth petrol bomb municipal vehicles during a service delivery protest. The Public Order Policing unit are deployed to the scene.

Taxi drivers protest over the introduction of subsidised bus services by Autopax which they claim will deprive them of customers. The taxi drivers hassle commuters and try to dissuade them from using the service.

Taxi drivers barricade the Autopax depot to prevent Autopax buses from leaving. The demonstrators demand that taxi associations be given the Mamelodi route instead of the Autopax buses argue that the subsidised bus service will cost them business.
Strike action against South Africas second-biggest mobile network MTN continues as Communication Workers Union members protested outside MTN's Fairland office.

Residents of Lerato Park in Kimberly demonstrate in front of regional Premier Sylvia Lucas over the allocation of new houses after the deadline for the release of the list of beneficiaries passed without any information being released. The rioters burn tyres and jostle with police.
LGBT students at Univeristy of Cape Town protest after a leader in the UCT SRC posts comments denouncing the US Supreme Court's decision concerning same-sex marriage.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAFCEI: Southern African Faith Communities Environment Initiative
NOTES: An interfaith group protest against nuclear energy outside Parliament in a demonstration led by the Southern African Faith Communities Environment Institute.
Protesters demonstrate against the live-export of animals for slaughter. The protest takes place during the loading of 3000 live animals for export to Mauritius.
Taxi drivers in Mamelodi stone Autopax vehicles to protest against the introduction of a subsidised bus service.

Taxi drivers barricade the Autopax depot for a second day to prevent Autopax buses from leaving. The demonstrators demand that taxi associations be given the Mamelodi route instead of the Autopax buses argue that the subsidised bus service will cost them business.
Residents of Modderspruit barricade the road and protest that the nearby mines have not kept to their promises of providing employment for locals.
Mamelodi commuters angrily protest to Tshwane Mayor Kgosientso Ramokgopa about ongoing obstructions caused by taxi operations opposing the imposition of new bus routs.
Taxi drivers pelt Autopax vehicles with stones. The rioters oppose the introduction of subsidised Autopax buses which they say will deprive taxi drivers of business.

Protesters from Lesotho protest outside the offices of the Department of International Relations and Cooperation and demand that the government prioritise stabilising the political situation within Lesotho.
Taxi drivers opposing the introduction of new bus routes in the area by Autopax fire shots at Autopax vehicles. A woman was severely injured during the shooting.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a second day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
Activists protest outside a circus over its use of animals during shows.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a third day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
An ANC meeting to elect new leaders for the Eastern Cape's Mbizana sub-region leads to a clash in which the two factions throw bricks and stones at each other.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a fourth day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.

A dispute between two villages, Khuleka and Masemeni, over the distribution of jobs in Libode and a project to build a psychiatric ward and doctors' quarters at St Barnabas Hospital result in a clash between residents of each village. Two men, a ward councillor and a community member, sustain gunshot wounds.

Protesters picket the Lilian Ngoyi Memorial Centre's construction project and threaten to halt construction after 18 undocumented foreign nationals working on the project are arrested by police. The protesters are calling for more arrests as they claim that there are more than 18 undocumented foreign workers working on the project.
Hundreds of people in Melmoth peacefully protest in the streets, opposing bail for three murder suspects.
Residents of Majakaneng riot over the lack of employment opportunities for locals at a nearby mine. The demonstrators barricade roads and burn vehicles.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a fith day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
Residents of Mooinooi burn debris and pelt cars with stones. The protest comes after the community complained that the local mines do not employ them.
Dunoon residents march and demand that empty mobile classrooms be put to use as a new primary school for their children to attend.
Residents of Khayelitsha protest and demand that tavern owners stop selling alcohol to underage girls.
Two men accused of being behind a spate of robberies are stoned to death by community members.
Residents of Majakaneng riot for a second day and burn a truck.
Residents of Modderspruit riot for a sixth day. The demonstrators accuse a nearby mine of failing to provide employment for locals as promised.
Residents of Blackburn village barricade the road and stone cars during a service-delivery protest. The demonstrators claim they have been without electricity for days.
Letlhabile residents picket outside Brits Magistrate's Court during the trial of two women accused of burning a teenager to death. The demonstrators demand that the court not grant the suspects bail.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers' Union
NOTES: Members of SATAWU protest outside the Huguenot Tunnel, a toll road, over insufficient wages and poor working conditions.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers' Union
NOTES: Over 1000 SA Municipal Workers' Union members march to Port Elizabeth to hand over a list of demands, including he reinstatement of a scarce-skills allowance, the lifting of a three-year moratorium on filling vacancies, and the provision of land by the municipality to employees on which to build housing.
Taxi drivers go on strike after a number of taxis are impounded by the police following violent protests against the introduction of a subsidised bus service into the Mamelodi area.

Residents of Ficksburg march to the police station and demand action after four people are murdered in the township. The residents threaten to engage in vigilante violence if the police are unable to deal with criminals effectively.

A vigilante group consisting of Congolese, Zimbabweans and other foreign nationals badly beat a man suspected of robbing and murdering a Congolese man before handing the suspect over to the police. The murder of the Congolese man is believed to be a criminally rather than politically motivated killing.

Upset residents try to hand over a memorandum to the municipal manager. After the manager is found not to be present the residents start to throw stones at the mayor prompting a response by the police. A policeman is critically injured after he is run over by a bakkie driven by protesters trying to access the municipal offices.
Members of the Islamic Unity Convention march to parliament to demand that the government separate ties with Israel and push for the release of all Palestinian prisoners in Israeli jails.
Residents of Philippi stone and chase members of the fire and rescue crew after they arrive late to put out a shack fire, resulting in the destruction of 8 dwellings. No serious injuries reported.
Vigilantes burn and kill a man accused of stealing a television.

Residents of Ga-Mampuru block the road with burning tyres. The demonstrators are protesting against the lack of tarred roads and unemployment. The residents are also demanding employment at the local mines.
Residents of Ga-Mampuru continue to riot and burn a truck to use as a road block in a protest against the lack of employment opportunities and tarred roads.
ANC members, led by a local ANC councillor  attack EFF activists and smash their vehicles with bricks. There are no reports of serious injuries among the activists.
The IFP's ward chairman in KwaMashu is gunned down by unknown assailants after leaving a branch meeting.
Residents of Hout Bay burn down a derelict council building which had been housing homeless individuals. There had recently been a spate of crimes in the area surrounding the building.
A truck is burnt by protesters in Steelpoort. The action is believed to be related to the protests in Ga-Mampuru concerning the lack of employment and tarred roads.
Residents of Soweto throw stones and clash with the police when the police try to intervene to prevent a vigilante killing
Residents of Soweto stone a suspected thief to death
Prison guards at Losperfontein Correctional Prison  torture and assault prisoners after an inmate escapes.

A man is assassinated by unknown assailants in ongoing political violence at Glebelands Hostel. The root of the conflict is allegedly due to competition between different block committees at the hostel.

Ugandan and Kenyan Pokots attempted to grabs animals under protection of UPDF soldiers. Clashes occurred leading to two dead among Pokots'.
Strike of Kyambogo University's staff over pay rise.
Students' protests turned into riots when students started storming school's offices. Police forces intervened, using tear gas to disperse the crowd, arresting five.
Strike over contracts by Isimba dam workers.
Hundreds protest after Ethiopian Arline suspended its flights.
Clash between Alur and Bagungu led to one death, an Alur fishermen in Hoima. His wife was also injured.
Re-election of a former Imam, who had previously fired for being unqualified for the position, caused protests during Eid day in Soroti.
Protests erupted in Kabale Referral Hospital due to lack of security and violence against health agents. Police has been deployed to strengthen the security.
Following the death of an Alur fishermen few days ago, clashes occurred between Alur and Bagungu in Hoima. One person was killed and three others injured. Police was also deployed.
Due to an alleged theft, students stormed a dormitory. 2 students were injured during the riot while 13 arrested were later arrested and 120 suspended.
Students strike in Kantare Secondary School in Kabale
Residents of Gulu demonstrated against the local MP.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NRM Poor Youth Forum: National Resistance Movement Poor Youth Forum
NOTES: Poor Youth NRM protested in front of the US Embassy in Kampala to denounce alleged arrests of some of their members. Police officers stopped the protest.
Police officers arrest four demonstrators at an illegal protest.
Arua nursing students demonstrated to denounce poor management of examinations.
Taxi drivers protest their murder of a colleague in Livingstone.
Taxi drivers in Livingstone blocked roads, protesting against escalated cost of living and cost of petrol.
Students protest on Burma Road against lack of water.
Clash between Luvales and Lunda tribes over which language to use in schools. Zambezi area ward councillor killed.

ACTOR1: UPND: United Party for National Development
NOTES: Clashes between UPND and PF on church road after parliament member Syvia Masebo appeared before the Anti-Corruption Commission in Lusaka.
Police beat up students protesting against power cuts.
Zambia National Broadcasting Corp employees protested, demanding the removal of Director General, a PF member.
Members of the Harare South Housing Union, the Apex Board and Hilarious Housing Cooperative violently clash over the allocation of houses and evictions.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ACTOR2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU-PF youths alligned to Solomon Mujuru Housing Cooperative, led by Cde Oswell Gwanzura, and Cde Petronella Kagonye engage in a gun battle. Kagonye's bodyguards are also involved in the battle. There are no reported casualties.

Two individuals visit Telrose mine in Kadoma and demand $30 000 a week from the mine on behalf of Russell Goreraza, Grace Mugabe's son. The two individuals are assaulted by mine workers and chased from the premesis. Police return to Telrose mine and assault workers suspected of assaulting and chasing emissaries of Russell Goreraza, Grace Mugabe's son.

ACTOR1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: ZANU-PF youth invade and vandalise the farm of former Politburo Member and Minister of Masvingo Provincial Affairs Kudakwashe Bhasikiti. Farm workers are assaulted and seriously injured during the invasion.
Workers at Bata Shoe company down tools to pressure the shoe manufacturer to review their housing and transport allowances.
Police beat a freelance journalist after he photographs police beating a suspected thief.
Vendors protest and stand their ground against riot police who have been commissioned to remove their stalls.
Informal traders throw stones at police during an operation to remove street vendors from the CBD.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
ALLY_ACTOR_2: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
NOTES: Two factions of ZANU-PF fight running battles during a district election. Each side accuses the other of poll rigging and the use of 'Gamatox tactics'.
Police detain and beat vendors during a drive to remove informal traders from Harare CBD.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MDC-T: Movement for Democratic Change (Tsvangirai Faction)
NOTES: Opposition politicians and religious leaders lead a vigil for abducted activist Itai Dzamara in Harare.

Multiple vendors including leaders of National Vendors Union of Zimbabwe, Sten Zvorwadza and Samuel Wadzai were beaten up and arrested by police after demonstrating against confiscation of their wares.
A farm-owning couple are assaulted and robbed by men in police and military uniform.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: UFAWU: United Food and Allied Workers Union
NOTES: Workers and representatives of the United Food and Allied Workers Union protest against a ruling by the Supreme Court to legalise termination with three months notice and without benefits.
Hundreds of women staged a peaceful march in Harare demanding an end to early child marriages before handing over a petition to Minister of Women's Affairs.
